Reviews.Title: “Trip of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: Afy A
Reviews.Content: Hi, Me and my family just came back after a week in Istanbul we stayed at Zebreb hotel during our holiday and found the Hotel staff to be very nice and helpful at all times weather in morning or late night they went out there way to make sure we was happy with our stay. And Azad the hotel reception staff member was amazing he helped us organise our daily sight seeing from taxis to step by step places to visit and made sure we was getting the best out our holiday. This was the first time we have ever been to Istanbul and we already planning next trip. If you are going with a young family and have a newborn dont worry its got all the necessary things you will need for your stay. And beakfast lunch and dinner is great.

Reviews.Title: “Zagreb hotel after 2 years”
Reviews.Author: Hrivnac
Reviews.Content: We were there in September 2009 and in October 2011 again - had bed and breakfast. Our room was small, but clean and efficient. The bathroom furnishing was a little bit uncared after 2 years. The staff was still very helpful, polite and good English speaking. Breakfast was delicious and very tasty, not expensive. The hotel is good situated, the way from the Airport takes 30 min by Metro (to terminal) and then 5 min by foot (Metro Jetton is 2 YTL). To the city center you can go by foot or by tram (same jetton - 2 YTL) - the station is not so far. You can walk between the sights. EminÃ¶nÃ¼ Ferry Docks are a few tram stations too. There are sea buses (public transport) to the Asian side (same jetton), Golden horn (from 2 to 4 YTL) and Bosporus ferryboats (big trip to the Black Sea about one day is 26 YTL). Attention for private boats (all overrated). When you go by foot from University station direct to the sea, you will come to the district with natives (not for the tourists) with small shops, patisseries, kebab, strong tee and amazingly pub with beer (opposite is the prison). Pub with beer is near Metro terminal too. Great people every where.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: miasmith
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Zagreb hotel several times, because it's quite conveniently located and is good value for money. It's within walking distance from Aksaray metro station (unless you have really heavy luggage) and also from the main sights of Sultanahmet. The rooms are small but well-equipped, the breakfast is good and there's also a computer in the lobby for customers' use. A strange thing is that the reception is situated on the first floor, and there doesn't seem to be an elevator to the ground floor, so carrying your suitcase up and down is a bit hard. They also have a spa upstairs but I didn't use it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff & Food.”
Reviews.Author: SRLR
Reviews.Content: Thank you Trip Advisor, I choose this hotel based on the good reviews it has and it worked. The front desk staff members were nice and friendly, we checked in things were just OK, next day morning we were very very impressed with their complementary breakfast the selection, quality you name it, what a great value I can't stop talking about it to my friends, if you stay at this hotel do you self a favor and eat there, DO NOT skip their complementary breakfast. We did several tours recommended by the hotel, it was a good way to see the city. Started with a boat tour to the Black sea and the western part of Istanbul (take a jacket with you) very relaxing, we couldn't swim as they advertised as the water was cold however we had a good time. The second day a bus tour to the historic sights loved it, we visited The Blue Mosque, Sultan Abdul Hamid Palace....indeed... in addition to several other sights. At night we took the cruise dinner tour it was very entertaining. I highly recommend this hotel and I will go back again. Thank you and all the best.

Reviews.Title: “the best memories.”
Reviews.Author: fainaj
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel in a fantastic location. clean, comfortable, cosy! staff is very pleasant, very helpful, very professional. always with a smile, always attentive to every whim! delicious breakfast - fresh, plentiful food of a high quality. there is also a lovely swimming pool with a bar and music. and all of it for the very reasonable prise! highly recommended!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Like sleeping on Concrete”
Reviews.Author: BelindaB81
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the airport and the pick up was 45 minutes late!!!!! The rooms were clean, buffet breakfast was nothing special at all. The beds were the worst beds i've ever slept on, they were like sleeping on concrete. When i booked through there website 3 months prior I asked for a double bed for my self or my partner, of coarse first disappointment - twin beds. Their website booking gave me the option to book the swimming pool for free, when I arrived the reception said I did not pick this option, he said he would confirm with "bookings" 2 days later no response from him, when i went to book my return transfer to the airport, he pulled out my file and there was my free swimming pool reciept, I was so upset that they didn't even bother to let me know I was right. I have stayed in other hotels in instanbul, I will never make that mistake again by choosing this hotel. plus side: street markets are great around this area and the borek around the corner was to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: anncoates
Reviews.Content: Very good value hotel. Comfortable, clean and quiet. Breakfast buffet excellent. The staff were very helpful. I lost my ATM card and a gentleman at reception dialled the number to contact my bank for me. The roof pool is a great addition to have. It was in a very good location near to Sultanahmet and the bazaars.

Reviews.Title: “Rooftop Pool is a definite bonus in this city!”
Reviews.Author: StephEastMidlands
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the reviews. The hotel is well placed for all the sights and close to the tram stop, although we walked most of the time. The rooms were small and adequate for a few nights but I wouldn't want to stay more than a few days in one. The staff were very courteous and helpful. The breakfast was good with an amazing selection of hot and cold food. The very best thing about this hotel is the rooftop pool which although small, was a welcome respite. This city is crazy and I have never seen traffic like it. It is also one of the most interesting places I have ever visited. To be able to sunbathe and have a cool dip in the pool was wonderful. Oh yes, it was also good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: TanyaGP
Reviews.Content: Great location! 15 minute walk to most historical sites. 5 minute walk to the Grand Bazaar. The hotel is very clean. The rooms are very small but if you are here on vacation you only need the room to shower and sleep. Staff is very helpful. The breakfast bar is great. The pool and hammam are very clean and are a wonderful break after a day of sight seeing. Only downside is the hotel is next to 2 mosques which can wake you up every day for prayer calling at 5 a.m.!! My husband is a light sleeper and he woke up every day when they called for prayer.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel not so decent area”
Reviews.Author: Victoria1982_01
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and room service was done decently, but we found rooms quite small, particularly the one with three beds. Breakfast was quite satisfactory. Reception staff is very helpful with good good command of English. Enjoyed lazy Sunday near the roof pool. The location is quite close to Sultanahmet and major sights, very close to tram station, also there are lots of restaurants in 10 minutes walk distance. However we did not find the evening walks back to the hotel pleasant - lots of street traders selling fake brands, watches etc occupy all pedestrian area from the main road all the way to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel!! very helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: beccareeve
Reviews.Content: we were so happy with our stay here, we had a very young baby and the sfaff were so friendly and helpfull, giving us maps and advise on how to find our way around, and how much we should pay for things such as taxis so there was no need to pay a tour opperator. We stayed for 6 days and thought it was amazing values for money. the pool is small but nice and ideal for a dunk to get cool, also nice for a sun bath. we cant comment much on the food as we ate out. The location is brill, right by the tram and two stops from the bazzar 3 from the blue mosque. visit princes island, take the tram (1.75TL) to the ferry port and take the ferry (5TL) to the island. we would highly recomend a massage at the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: nellygiddy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in August. The hotel is officially rated a 4 star but is really a 3 star. Apart from this we enjoyed all aspects of our stay. The rooms were smallish but comfortable. The breakfast buffet was huge and well stocked. The pool is free to guests between 9am and 4pm and later than this if you enter berfore 4pm. The pool is on the roof and so you can sunbathe too. The hotel is close to the Askary tram stop and is about 25 minute walk to the main attractions of Istanbul ie Aya Sofya, Blue Mosque. It is also possible to take the tram to these. We found the hotel to be very good value and while not luxurious to be comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: BroadstoneDave
Reviews.Content: Turkey's idea of a 4-star hotel is quite bizarre! I reckon 2-star would be about right. For starters, the reception is on the first floor - and there is no lift from the ground floor. So don't go there if you are not so steady on your legs. The staircase is a spiral and not the safest. Breakfast consists of a bewildering variety of food (40 or more different items), although quality is not the best. My wife found mould on some of the dried fruit, the hot selection looked inedible, and pancakes (one of the star attractions) were not renewed after they ran out. So you need to get to breakfast early! As for the coffee .... well, Turkey is well known for its "Turkish coffee", but in the hotel it varied between weak and lightly coloured water. Not once did we have decent coffee in the week we stayed there. The alternative was a Nescafe machine ... horrible!! The location is good - close to the tram. But again, quite a climb up the street to get there (OK for younger people). The only things we liked at the hotel were : the shower (although it leaked onto the bathroom floor); the reception staff - very helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Perfect Location and Friendliest Staff”
Reviews.Author: ldn_dj_cakes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 11 nights in July, the hotel is very clean, very good location, short distance to the tram stops (Lalleli and Aksaray), 10 mins walk to Grand Bazaar, 15 mins walk to Cemberlitas Hammami and SÃ¼leymaniye Mosque, 25 mins walk to the Blue Mosque. The hotel staff were amazing, very helpful and always keen to help and give you advice. The swimming pool is great, especially to cool down after a long hot day (Free swimming pool between 9am and 4pm). Room service was good, anything you ask for they'll get it for you within 5 mins. Free internet through out the hotel, very good speed too. Buffet Breakfast is included in your stay, great selection, lots of variety to choose from. There's a good mini supermarket across the hotel, good to get water and Ayran from there. Special Thank you to Ismael, Azad and the two other guys (sorry forgot your names!) at Reception for always helping us out and Mourad at the Spa for an amazing service and always giving us advice where to go in Istanbul :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: pagaripiparkook123
Reviews.Content: Zagreb is within walking distance from the main sights in Sultanahmet and underground station in Aksaray, which makes it a perfect location. Rooms are small but very nice and there is also a spa upstairs. The only problem was that the elevator didn't seem to go to the ground floor, so it was necessary to carry your bag up the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Happytravelllers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Zargreb for 4 nights in May, the hotel is in a good location, just a short walk to the tram stop which takes you everywhere for less than a Â£1! Staff were really friendly and helpful, the hotel was clean, the room was a bit small so was the shower but this did not effect our stay. The breakfast was good with a choice (Turkish Style) Would stay here again if we went back to this exciting city!! My only complaint would be that if you want to use the swmming pool etc there is a 15 dollar charge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and value for money”
Reviews.Author: janetofsheffield
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff with excellent reception Excellent breakfast Hotel and rooms extremely clean and well decorated Pool excellent bonus and hardly used. Room on 3rd floor and quiet Tram just 4 minute walk away Would recommend, excellent value for money and would return.

Reviews.Title: “?bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: catdea
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from the Zagreb hotel and cannot understand the bad reviews I read before I went which paniced me into thinking where was I going to!! we were 2 girls but I cannot rate this hotel highly enought and the service we received!! it is a great location and I would recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE OF THE SCAM - ZAGREB INSTANBUL”
Reviews.Author: THEWALS_10
Reviews.Content: If you have prepaid your accommodation at this hotel, be prepared to be told they have an electrical problem in your room & you will be transferred to another 4 star hotel. This happened to us on 2 seperate occassions. The other 4 star hotel was a 1 star dive !!! We believe they are accepting your money and then on selling your room whist transferring you to a cheap hotel. On the 2nd occassion we made a fuss at the reception desk & were magically found a room. The hotel has lovely rooms & good, breakfast . just be warned not to pre pay your accommodation at this hotel. Anyone interested we have taken photos comparing the 2 hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug186605
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel. Very clean, staff very friendly and helpful, breakfasts very good, and the pool was amazing and worth the money. You can use the pool free once a day. However, beware that our room was very very small (not a double room) and can get very stressful if you are staying for more than a night. We barely had room for our suitcases. Good location within walking distance of the Grand Bazaar and the main sights.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: oxanna74
Reviews.Content: i stayed in zagreb hotel at the end of august with my mother for 4 nights. the room are very clean and nice. the breakfast was good They had delicious pancakes witth vanilla cream. Good location at 10 minutes from tram station

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: DiddyBulgaria
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Zagreb Hotel for 6 nights and enjoyed a really great time there: nice and tidy room with any amenities available. The staff is very helphul and all of them speak English which is really an advantage in Istanbul. The hotel delivered us additional services accurately (just like organized car transfers to and from places we wanted to visit, car parking, etc.) on reasonable prices. The hotel is sutuated in the very center of the city, on a walking distance from the main tourist attractions, but it avoids the crowds of the main tourists spots. Tram transportation nearby is also very convenient. It's safe to walk around the hotel even by night. Very rich breakfast. You should only mind that if you want to use the pool and the sauna, you need to each time pay an additional fee.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Four Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: singleparentdad
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my ten year old son. This hotel lives up to its four star standard. Excellent staff, service, rooms and location. Wonderful roof top swimming pool. On tram line direct to all important sites.

Reviews.Title: “Everything OK, if only they hadn't doublebooked!”
Reviews.Author: atfos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Zagreb hotel on August 2010 for 4 days. Everything was fine, the room, the food, the service, the reception. The location is not so good, it is a bit far from the tram station, 5 minutes walk in the mid summer sun is not easy. The taxis won't always get you where you want because of heavy traffic and one way streets. The big problem was that they double dooked and they sent us to another hotel for the first day. Even thought the 2nd hotel was as good, it was not at all a pleasant experience. After being assured that everything was OK the second day, we returned to Zagreb hotel only to be told that they still didn't have a room for us and that we had to go to another hotel! After a rather noisy conversation they gave as a room for two (we were three) with an extra small bed just for one day, "by tomorrow everything would be OK". We took the room and next day they changed our room for a bigger one but with an extra small bed instead of a normal bed as one would expect in a triple room! Another verbal fight and they changed the bed. For all that, we were offered free access to the pool, the sauna, the turkish bath. I don't know what to think, i hope it was just bad handling of an unfortunate situation, but i won't go there again... That's too bad, the hotel deserved a better review...

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: SarahSahn
Reviews.Content: The complimentary breakfast was extraordinary!! When lunch time came around i would still be full from breakfast. The people at the front desk were very helpful when my key card wouldn't work (which was just about everyday). I Didn't stop by the pool because it costed $10 (not lira) to enter in the pool area, so I stayed away from it. To enter in the hotel you have to walk up a mini spiral stair case, so the people at the desk would help with our luggage which was much needed! It wasn't overly noisy at night, and in the morning it would be virtually silent up until 10-11am. The rooms were small but I kind of expected that. They were clean. But one thing i noticed in Turkey in general is that they don't provide face towels (the little square towel). THey only provide you with a body towel (the big ones like a beach towel) and a hand towel (the long skinny ones). And I visited both Ankara and Istanbul and both hotels didn't provide face towels which i found both annoying and interesting. Zagreb is situated right in the business district. There are a lot of stores around so I tried to walk around and go shopping but I soon became disappointed when store after store informed me that they only sold wholesale. But no worries! The Grand Bazaar is in walking distance maybe like 5-6 blocks down following the train line and If you're not sore you can even walk 5-6 blocks further down to Sultanahmet and visit Hagia Sophia and the Blue mosque and that whole little tourist area. So the location was pretty convenient for me. And i'm not the fittest person so at the end of the day, i felt like i had a full blown workout at the gym!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel like Home”
Reviews.Author: haggisMarlborough
Reviews.Content: On my arrival I was collected at Ataturk Airport courtesy coach. I was Jet Lagged after a x12 hour flight ! On arrival the staff were the best in any Hotel I have ever stayed at. I felt like they were family.....I even felt ok going back to see them when I ran into problems with another Hotel (the Hotel from Hell!*%$@@!@#$#% Optimist Hotel opposite the Blue Mosque). I had a wonderful dinner, and was entertained by two musicians......one 17yr old boy, played the Zither...terrific... The room was c lean, handy to everything. Not noisy even though the street vendors went all night down below. They even served me an early Ã¢m breakfast before I went to Gallipoli. I loved the whole experience and would go again. I had a

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: IJBLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really good value. Comfortable and well furnished. Rooms are small but not unduly so for such a high density city. Good breakfasts with lots of choice. Right next to the tram line. We were stranded for 2 nights at the end of our stay because the volcano ash and the manager was SO helpful - he gave us the room for another night at the same (discount) rate and when the hotel was full the next night organised a room for us at a nice hotel over the road (again at the discount).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brytom
Reviews.Content: During our Easter Holidays we stayed in Zagreb Hotel and enjoyed our stay very much. Friendly staff, nice breakfast, good location and excellent spa and swimming pool. Very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with good staff and excellent facilities”
Reviews.Author: travellingcherry
Reviews.Content: We arrived before 12pm and they worked immediately to get the room ready for us. The staff spoke good English and whipped up a couple of Turkish coffees while we waited. Our room was as small as it possibly could be while still being functional â€“ according to the plan we were in the smallest room on the floor and it suited our needs perfectly. Our companions had a triple room which was almost double the size and adequately housed three single beds. We received a nice welcome plate of fruits and various cans and bottles of drinks including wine. The room was serviced daily and was very clean. The in-house toiletries were also very nice. We had French doors on the street side â€“ the road is very noisy with car horns and shop hecklers during the day but lovely and quiet at night. As with every hotel in Istanbul, take earplugs if you are a light sleeper â€“ the call to prayer probably starts before you do. The hotel pool is pretty small but provides a nice spot to cool down or rest your feet. The best thing about the pool terrace is the shimmering view of the Sea of Marmara, with a constant traffic jam that makes the streets look tame. The spa/ Turkish bath/ sauna are extra and not worth paying for â€“ save your money for a proper Hamam. Breakfast is plentiful with a good selection of Turkish foods such as simit (sesame seed bread rings sold at breakfast by the street sellers) and marinated Turkish white cheese (like feta). There is a large selection of salads, cold meats and egg dishes, hot foods such as sausages, scrambled and hard boiled eggs and potatoes, cereals, yogurts and fruits â€“ head down before 0830 to grab the best bits such as the sinful chocolate filled pancakes. During the evening the hotel restaurant has live Turkish music which is a nice accompaniment to a Turkish tea on the sofas. We used the hotel shuttle to return to airport, it was prompt and good value compared to a taxi cab. Location wise the hotel is just off Genoturk Cad., a busy street in the heart of the tailor district, surrounded by suit shops, small grocery stores and great kebab houses on Divan Yolu Cad. The Aksaray tram station is 7 minutesâ€™ walk, 1.50TL will take you to the heart of Sultanahmet. To the north is the Sezhade Mehmet Mosque (and restaurant) and the Aquaduct of Valens. Divan Yolu Cad. is a very busy shopping street which heads east to the Grand Bazaar. Take time to smoke a nagileh in the small bazaar tea garden behind the hotel. An excellent hotel in a prime location with friendly staff, good facilities and tasty breakfast - excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: cathy2sh0es
Reviews.Content: Despite reading reviews on Trip Advisor which were a bit mixed - I wasn't sure what to eexpect. We got a good deal on our booking - so I didn't have very high expectations. After all, you usually get what you pay for. So I was delighted when I arrived late after a delayed flight to be met at the hotel door and have my case whisked up to my room - the entrance is on the ground floor and lugging my case up that final staircase would about have finished me off I think. Obviously, the fact that reception is on the first floor is going to cause problems for visitors with mobility problems - although there is a lift to all other floors. My room (a twin) was adequately spacious and certainly not cramped. The shower room was a good size too. There was a small (window ledge sized) balcony, fridge, safe and flat screen TV - with many international channels but sadly only BBC World News in English. (Although we spent a merry hour with the duty free vodka watching what we guessed was "Turkey's Got Talent"). The rooms/bathrooms and public areas were spotlessly clean. The staff were attentive, friendly and helpful - even if their english was limited, they went out of their way to help. They organised a fabulously seamfree transfer back to the airport at a seriously ungodly hour of the morning and were all really nice and polite. The breakfast, which was included in the price, was lavish - with something for every taste - a range of breads, cakes, pastries and preserves, cereal, cold buttet with meat, cheese, salad, pickles etc. And hot dishes like boiled and scrambled eggs (and also to my surprise one morning - chips!). We only ate dinner in the hotel on our last night - and although it was ok, you could get better deals and more variety eating out. There's a small bar that sells (sweet) snacks. Prices are around the same as we paid in other bars - and cheaper than some. There's free internet access in reception I didn't use it myself - but it seemed to be working and in use a lot of the time. The hotel is within reasonal walking distance of the Grand Bazaar and a few minutes walk from the tramway which can take you to all the major areas of interest. I might not stay there again as I like to try different places - but I would certainly be happy to recommend it. It's not cool , trendy or lively and the decor is a bit over the top for my taste but it's a good, solid, comfortable hotel. There's also a rooftop swimming pool and a turkish bath and spa facilities available - but I didn't try those out.

HotelInfo.Name: Zagreb Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Laleli Kemalpasa Mah. Gencturk Cad. | CukurceÅŸme Sok. No:29, Istanbul 34470, Turkey
